Text.Value: Where do you keep your riches?
*The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*
*...and you note its delicate filaments. It had been merely a child.*
How do I get past the door to your treasure?
((*...to grow. to know. to be one with the Circle...*))
*The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
How did you die?
*The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
*...and awaits your first question.*
Leave.
((*...floating, knowing, seeing, hearing. all together, never apart...*))
*Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*
*The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Dead Myconid sprout] lying progressively on the ground

Text.Value: *...and you note its delicate filaments. It had been merely a child.*
*Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*
((*...gnome. death. gnome-death...*))
*Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*
These grey dwarves - what did they want here?
((*...magic. behind the... the door*))
((*...bang! grey dwarves... hurt hurt hurt...*))
What was your role in the circle?
*The corpse regards you lifelessly.*
*Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*
*Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*
Who were you?
((*...old ones enter. Sovereign enters. no one else...*))
What was life in the circle like?

Synopsis: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
